title: Reudo KSync for Mac 5
description:
If you have a Japanese cell phone and ever tried to sync it with your Mac, you&#039;ve probably found that iSync doesn&#039;t want to talk to it.  This is where KSync comes in.  You have to buy this program from a company called Reudo for close to $30 and all it really is is just iSync plugins.  That&#039;s a bit steep in my opinion (like so many other seemingly simple Mac apps) so I&#039;m uploading it here to help others.

Just open the DMG and click on the mpkg.  It&#039;s fairly simple.  You will need to use the USB cable for your phone to sync.  I tried bluetooth and it doesn&#039;t work.

I&#039;ve tested this on my Softbank 911T, but this program should work with most, if not all, Japanese cell phones.

If you found this useful, please seed to help others out.
